release_notes.en-US: - republished because of download error Mozilla site

description.en-US: This gives you a style similar to MS Office XP in your Thunderbird menus and toolbars, and Calendar as well if you have that installed. It also changes the category-selector in the options window to use your system colors, instead of always being blue. And it gives you the extra options to remove the dropdown from the "get new messages" button and to remove the separators between menus. This extension is mostly based on the FlatStyle extension for Firefox by Andreas Westerlind. Thanks Andreas! EXTENSION DISCONTINUED: This extension is discontinued. Similar functionalities can be found in the "CuteMenus - Crystal SVG" extension as of version 1.8. Please have a look at http://www.cutemenuproject.com/

developer_comments.en-US:
ChangeLog:
[0.9.2.6]
- republished because of download error Mozilla site
[0.9.2.5]
- bugfix 1px shift menubar when (de)selecting email messages
- fixed clear-search button appearing too small
- applies to contact sidebars (req. by Louis Moore)
[0.9.2.4]
- added locale Slovak, thanks to Jan Kendi
[0.9.2.3]
- updated for Thunderbird 1.5
[0.9.2.2]
- flatstyles extension/theme managers as well
[0.9.2]
- Andreas made the menu items thicker (more like Office XP)
[0.9.1.4]
- applied the FoxyTunes mouseover fix of the FireFox version
[0.9.1.3]
- two small visual fixes for Thunderbird 1.5b users
- improved defaults of the Flatstyle settings
[0.9.1.1]
- initial release

Please send bug reports and suggestions by email. Thanks and enjoy.
